jot.math.geometry.generators.terrain

Class AbstractTerrainGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.math.geometry.Mesh
      • jot.math.geometry.PolygonMesh
        • jot.math.geometry.generators.AbstractGeometryGenerator
          • jot.math.geometry.generators.terrain.AbstractTerrainGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiamondSquare, Noise

    public abstract class AbstractTerrainGenerator
extends AbstractGeometryGenerator
    Abstract class that each terrain generator must extend.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTerrainGenerator

        public AbstractTerrainGenerator(int lod,
                                float roughness,
                                float size)
        Constructor, sets the application Window, and initializes the terrain height map.
        Parameters:
        lod - the level of detail of the heightmap to generate. lod corresponds to the integer variable k in the formula (2 ^ k) + 1, where k = 1, 2, 3 ... is the value of both the length and width of the heightmap, stored in the GeometryGen class "terrain" variable. The value of (2 ^ k) + 1 gives the number of points per line of the grid. The higher k is the more detailed is the generated heightmap, i.e., more points are generated. Consequently, more details means more time to calculate the heightmap values, and to render the generated terrain.
        roughness - the value that will increase or decrease the random interval added to each new generated height.
        size - (considering a squared game world) of one of the game world sides.

        This method generates a terrain.

      • generateGeometry

        public void generateGeometry()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGeometryGenerator

      • smoothTerrain

        public void smoothTerrain(int smoothFactor,
                          AbstractSurface smoother)
        Smooths the terrain to make it less irregular. Some terrain generators require smoothing to clean some visual artifacts, i.e., spikes
        Parameters:
        smoothFactor - relates to the amount of extra points required to generate for the surface smoothing.
        smoother - the specific smoother algorithm to use.

      • getAltitude

        public float getAltitude(int i,
                         int j)
        Get an specific altitude stored in the height map with coordinates i and j.
        Parameters:
        i - the coordinate that correspond to the x axis in OpenGL coordinates.
        j - the coordinate that correspond to the z axis in OpenGL coordinates.
        Returns:
        the value of the altitude in coordinates i and j.

      • getSmoothAltitude

                               int j)

        Returns:
